Address:5/301 Ved Vihar, Near Chandani Chowk, Paud Road, Kothrud
Website:https://1step.health

Profile:
Avantza Technologies is a Pune-based company which has developed the 1Step health app. The goal of 1Step is to make health & wellness: 1) Easy to understand - For that, we have come up with the '4-3-2-1 Framework'. We have also started making educational videos on the 1Step YouTube channel. 2) Possible to achieve - For that we have built the app which adopts a 3-pronged strategy: Learn, Do, and Track. And it focuses on giving users Vitamin P (P1=Personalization and P2=Persistence). The mission of 1Step is to make a potitive impact in the lives of a million people by the end of 2027. Once we achieve that goal, we will take on an even more ambitious target!

Founded by environmental engineers and researchers, we deliver reliable, end-to-end water and wastewater treatment solutions. Guided by a deep respect for nature, we apply data-driven tools and intelligent process control to solve persistent challenges in wastewater treatment that hinder consistent, long-term performance. We are developing Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning algorithms to modernise wastewater treatment plants and upgrade inefficient or failed systems into fully automated, smart facilities using proven technologies like Membrane Bio Reactors (MBR).

Profile:
ABX3 PV Private Limited is India’s first indigenous company developing and manufacturing next-generation Perovskite Solar Cells (PSCs) and hybrid module technologies. Its mission is to deliver low-cost, scalable, and high efficiency solar energy solutions that are entirely conceived and built in India. India currently faces a major challenge — heavy dependence on imported solar technologies. ABX3PV aiming to eliminate foreign technology dependency and India to leapfrog beyond conventional silicon manufacturing and achieve genuine self reliance in solar energy under Atmanirbhar Bharat and the upcoming National Perovskite Mission.

We are, • India’s first certified organic milk brand. • Focused on a sustainable and healthier food ecosystem. • Researching innovative farming technologies. • Transforming farming style and the life of farmers. • Providing farm visits to learn about the lifestyle. • Running milk packet recycling program. Address:303, Innovation lab, 11 Geumto-ro 80beon-gil
Website:https://autol.co.kr/

Profile:
AutoL is a specialized company in manufacturing LiDAR sensors. Unlike radar, which uses radio waves, LiDAR uses light to detect objects and measure their distance. This allows LiDAR to provide higher resolution and better performance in nighttime conditions. By applying AutoL's special high-sensitivity transceiver technology, the size and cost of LiDAR have been significantly reduced, and naturally, it has been optimized as an outdoor LiDAR with excellent performance even in extreme environments. It can be used not only in automobiles and robots but also in smart city infrastructure and security systems, demonstrating its wide-ranging potential.

The university offers a variety of undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral programs across its five faculties—arts, commerce, science, education, and language—and is affiliated with over 200 colleges in the city's central area. It carries forward the 160-year legacy of the Central College, which was founded in 1858 as "Bengaluru High School".

The company’s core services include Business set up, tax registrations, intellectual property registration, legal documentation, accounting, audit and fund raising documentation and support.

C-DAC BANGALORE

Sector:R&D and Central Govt.
Contact :Mrs. Divya MG
Designation:Scientist F
Mobile:+91-9449994478
E-mail:divyam@cdac.in
Address:C-DAC Knowledge Park, No.1, Old Madras Road, Byappanahalli, Bangalore - 560038
Website:https://www.cdac.in

Profile:
C-DAC is an autonomous Scientific Society under the MeitY, Government of India. Established in 1988 as India’s national initiative for design, development and delivery of HPC systems & solutions based on parallel processing technology, it has over the years transferring the expertise and technologies it developed in the high-end computing to develop & deploy advanced IT based solutions. Through this approach, developing strategic technologies needed in the HPC area for achieving self-reliance, addressing mission critical problems in the S & T fields & using expertise developed to commercialize its technologies & products to meet the requirements in the key sectors.

C-DAC- PUNE

Sector:R&D and Central Govt.
Contact :Mr. Sandeep Malviya
Designation:Scientist F
Mobile:+91-9890586180
E-mail:sandeepm@cdac.in
Address:C-DAC Innovation Park, Panchavati, Pashan, Pune - 411 008, Maharashtra (India)
Website:https://cdac.in/

Profile:
C-DAC, under MeitY, is India’s premier R&D organization in IT and Electronics. Established in 1988 to build indigenous supercomputers after import denial, it created the PARAM series and advanced India’s HPC capabilities. C-DAC also pioneered Indian Language Computing and expanded into AI, Cyber Security, Quantum Computing, IoT, Health Informatics, and e-Governance. Through its national training programs like PG-DAC, it develops skilled IT professionals. Today, C-DAC drives key missions, including the National Supercomputing Mission, supporting India’s digital growth and self-reliance.

Profile:
CarbSorb Solutions Pvt. Ltd. (CSPL) is a pioneer in a breakthrough holistic decarbonization technology. Our advanced biomass gasification system transforms agro-residues and municipal solid waste into green hydrogen, green carbon which are clean alternatives to fossil fuels. Scalable from 2.5 to 500 TPD, the technology not only eliminates fossil carbon emissions but also removes atmospheric CO₂ through bioresource recycling. By utilizing green Hydrogen and Carbon to generate sustainable fuels such as methanol, ethanol, and SAF, CSPL’s innovation delivers a complete circular solution for energy security and climate resilience.

Centre for Development of Telematics (C-DOT) was established in August 1984 as an autonomous Telecom R&D centre of DoT, Govt. of India. It is a registered 'public funded research institution' with the Department of Scientific and Industrial Research (DSIR), Ministry of Science & Technology, Government of India. Hailed as the progenitor of the Indigenous Telecom Revolution in the nation, C-DOT, with more than 4 decades of its relentless R&D efforts in the indigenous design, development and production of telecom technologies especially suited to the Indian landscape, have been in the technology forefront and has significantly contributed to the Indian Telecom Network's Digitization.

Our platforms include- PathCrisp for molecular, point of need testing for genetic disorders, infectious disease and food safety, EdiCrisp for engineering multiple species in biomedical discovery to sustainable fuel production and CurieCrisp for iPSC-CRISPR models for rare genetic disorders-driving accessible high-impact genetic tools through a cross-functional team.

EARTH AND ORGANICS

Sector:EV, Energy, Climate, Water, Soil, GSDI
Contact :Mrs. Anjali Patil
Designation:Anjali Patil
Mobile:+91-9900024242
E-mail:anjali@earthandorganics.in
Address:963 3rd Cross, HRBR I Block, Kalyanagar
Website:http:www.earthanorganics.in

Profile:
We provide a full stack reuse service that help FMCG brands reduce waste generated from single-use packaging waste. This also helps them comply with EPR regulations. Our fully automated, trackable dispensers can be installed in locations like retail store, public places for retail and B2B use cases, and customers carry their own packaging for buying the product like rice for example. FMCG brands rent out the dispensers, they are sent to the brands, brands fill them with the FMCG product and are sent to the retail stores. Empty dispensers are collected by us for cleaning and reuse. Every refill of a 50 kg rice dispenser avoids 50 single-use plastic packets.

Our modular, cell-agnostic design lowers lifecycle costs, extends battery life, and enables fast, scalable deployment through compact swap stations that can be setup in any kirana store/bakery/small establishment. Our technology has been validated in the defence sector, with indigenously designed and manufactured helicopter engine starter battery packs, for the armed forces.

GREENWATER SCIENTIFIC

Sector:EV, Energy, Climate, Water, Soil, GSDI
Contact :Mr. Dhruv Mehta
Designation:Founder & Director
Mobile:+91-9711450509
E-mail:dm@greenwaterscientific.com
Address:Plot-138 Sector 5 IMT Manesar Nsg Camp Manesar, Nsg Camp Manesar
Website:https://greenwaterscientific.com

Profile:
The World Health Organizaition says CO2 levels above 1000 PPM are toxic. You’re probably reading this in a room with over 1500 PPM. This causes daily headaches, decision fatigue, and cognitive decline. In the long term, we experience poorer lung, mental as well as heart health. greenwaterHOME uses the photosynthetic power of micro-algae to generate fresh oxygen and capture carbon exponentially faster than plants & trees. We also use HEPA, carbon, and pre-filters to capture PM2.5 and other pollutants like traditional air purifiers. Our likely customers are new parents, health-conscious individuals and Commercial Real Estate developers as our products can improve WELL and LEED ratings.

Profile:
GritWorks has developed GritMold, an enterprise platform for generating real-world synthetic data at scale. GritMold produces realistic documents, identity cards, passports, voice recordings, call transcripts, and biometric data for application testing and AI model training. Organizations across healthcare, banking, insurance, and AI use GritMold to test enterprise workflows, train OCR and document processing systems, and develop AI models without exposing real customer data—ensuring full compliance with GDPR, HIPAA, and DPDP regulations.

Profile:
IKP began its journey as India’s first Life Sciences Park in 1999 in Hyderabad's Genome Valley, primarily focusing on providing infrastructure services. Our 200-acre campus, co-locating global MNCs, corporations, and start-ups with shared labs, working spaces, and analytical facilities formed the blueprint for a life sciences innovation ecosystem in India. Over the years, we’ve evolved into a go-to incubator: operating in Hyderabad and Bangalore, offering incubation and innovation services across diverse sectors, including life sciences and biotech, agriculture and agritech, digital health and medical devices, energy and climate change, engineering, one health, and others.

The hub will co-create partnerships and spearhead scholarships, collaborative PhD networks and fellowships in AI, quantum, biotech, advanced materials, and climate and health innovation—deepening India-UK collaboration across research, education and enterprise.

Profile:
CeNSE (Centre for Nano Science and Engineering) is a research and development centre within Indian Institute of Science (IISc), Bengaluru. It is a forefront organization for research in Nano Technology and Semiconductors, containing 3 National Labs, including the country's largest Fab Facility. INCeNSE and GEECI are incubators within this ecosystem, both focus on specialized areas. INCeNSE - focuses on Nano Technology and Deep Tech. GEECI is an incubator that specializes on GaN based startups. Together the three organizations work in unison to support the growth of the semiconductor ecosystem in India, through trainings, research and industry collaboration.

Profile:
Karnataka Power Transmission Corporation Limited is a registered company under the Companies Act, 1956 was incorporated on 28-7-1999 and is a company wholly owned by the Government of Karnataka with an authorised share capital of Rs. 2182.32 crores. KPTCL was formed on 1-8-1999 by carving out the Transmission and Distribution functions of the erstwhile Karnataka Electricity Board. KPTCL is headed by a Chairman and Managing Director at the Corporate office. The Managing Director is assisted by four functional Directors. The Board of KPTCL consists of a maximum of twelve directors.

Profile:
Karnataka Soaps and Detergents Limited (KSDL), owned by the Government of Karnataka, established initially in 1916 as the Government Sandalwood Oil Factory. It manufactures personal care products,and noted for its heritage brand, Mysore Sandal Soap, which has a Geographical Indication tag since 2006 to protect its authenticity. It is an ISO 9001 and ISO 14001 certified company, reflecting its commitment to quality management and environmental preservation. The company faces competition from large FMCG players but retains a strong brand loyalty due to its unique sandalwood-based products.Apart from soaps and sandalwood oil, KSDL produces detergents, fragrances, talcum powder, hand washes etc.

KARNATAKA STATE REMOTE SENSING APPLICATIONS CENTER

Sector:Information Technology
Contact :Mr. Rajashekar A S
Designation:Senior Scientific Group and Group Head
Mobile:+91-9880369958
E-mail:rajashekar.as@ksrsac.in
Address:Doora Samvedi Bhavana, Major Sandeep Unnikrishnan Road, Doddabettahalli, Bengaluru-560 097.
Website:https://ksrsac.karnataka.gov.in

Profile:
The Karnataka State Remote Sensing Applications Centre (KSRSAC) was established in the year 1986 and designated as the Nodal Agency for implementation of Remote Sensing(including Photogrammetry) and GIS programmes in the State vide Government Order No.ITD 28 MIS 2002, Bangalore dated 06.08.2002. The nodal agency will create GIS base maps and general/common features and provide full services on Remote Sensing and GIS to all the Line Departments. The nodal agency will work out the planning/architecture of Remote Sensing and GIS implementation / feasibility for new proposals as well as to organize periodic workshops to bring more interaction and co-ordination among the Line Departments.

Profile:
Mycelius. is tackling the dual challenge of waste and pollution in construction and interiors. India generates over 500 million tons of agricultural waste yearly, much of which is burned, worsening air quality. Simultaneously, conventional wall panels drive nearly 40% of global building emissions. Our fungi-based panels, grown from mycelium and agriculture waste, offer a carbon-neutral, non-toxic alternative; reducing emissions, preventing open-air burning, and promoting circular design. Biodegradable and high-performance, they redefine sustainable interiors for a cleaner, healthier future.

NAIN, 2.0 , DIMHANS DHARWAD 1

Sector:Healthtech
Contact :Dr. Shivarudrappa Bhairappanavar
Designation:CEO
Mobile:+91-7069084098
E-mail:rudra8282.dimhans@gmail.com
Address:Near S P Office Belgaum Road
Website:https://dimhans.karnataka.gov.in/en

Profile:
Institute was started as “Lunatic asylum” in 1845 by the British Government in the premises attached to the jail midst of the lush green vegetated 18 acres of land for keeping mentally ill who were discriminated against and stigmatized by restraining using chains and secluded from society and family members. Later in 1885, some rooms of the jail were used as wards for keeping patients. On 25 Sept 1908 Superintendent Engineer of Southern India wrote a letter to the superintendent of Bombay province to provide a place to establish mental asylum at Dharwad along with Yerawad (Pune), Colaba, Ratnagiri, and Thana. Considering the cold climatic conditions of the region, the asylum was established

Address:National Internet Exchange of India (NIXI) B-901, 9th Floor Tower B, World Trade Centre, Nauroji Nagar, New Delhi-110029
Website:https://nixi.in/

Profile:
National Internet Exchange of India is a not-for-profit organization under Section 8 of the Companies Act, 2013, established in 2003, has been providing critical Internet infrastructure in India for over 22 years. Created to enable peering among ISPs for routing domestic traffic within the country, NIXI improves service quality, reduces latency and lowers bandwidth costs. It operates the .IN & .भारत (IDN) domain names, supporting digital growth and multilingual Internet access. As India’s National Internet Registry, IRINN allocates IP addresses, promotes IPv6 adoption. With IXPs across metros and Tier II/III cities, NIXI enhances connectivity, accessibility and digital inclusion nationwide.

RUGGEDBOARD

Sector:Electronics & Semiconductor
Contact :Mr. SREENIVAS KOLA
Designation:SREENIVAS KOLA
Mobile:+91-8686460061
E-mail:sreenivas.k@phytec.in
Address:Phytec Bengaluru No. 1688, 25th Cross, 27th Main Rd, opp. PEP School V2, 2nd Sector, HSR Layout, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560102
Website:https://WWW.COMMUNITY.RUGGEDBOARD.COM

Profile:
RuggedBoard is an Open Source Hardware & Software initiative to align with the fast-growing Semiconductor technologies with a switch from classic to modern product development strategy & process. The usage of System On Module over a System On Chip is the most rapid way to achieve time to market, curtail development risks for product quantities ranging from few to thousands. RuggedBoard team targets to combine the Open Source Community strength with Industrial-Grade SOM and initiated the first Open Source Hardware "RuggedBoard-A5D2x" which is powered by phyCORE-A5D2 SOM with Microchip SAMA5D2x SoC, Cortex-A5 Core @500 MHz. The Open Source IoT stack based on Intel MRAA & UPM developed in C/C++

Personal details of sellers is kept confidential thus avoiding spam calls and fraudsters. 2.Every product is physically verified by validators, who are aadhar KYC verified members. They check the quality of product before it is listed for sale. 3.Seller get best price as price is determined by market demand where buyers bid for product. 4. Blockchain Technolgy used to safeguard transaction data.

Website:https://www.signsetu.com

Profile:
SignSetu is India’s first ISL-integrated, gamified, and visual-first ed-tech platform for Deaf students (ages 6–18), educators, and inclusive institutions. It bridges communication and literacy barriers through structured vocabulary lessons linked to images, Indian Sign Language videos, and contextual sentences. In a 15-day pilot in Chennai, students showed 50–75% improvement in word recall with just 15 minutes of daily use. SignSetu has signed an MoU with ISLRTC to align with national ISL standards and is working towards integration with NCERT and state education departments. Winner of awards from UNDP, NCPEDP-Mphasis, and StartupTN, SignSetu is known as “Duolingo for the Deaf.”

Profile:
StrideAide is a Bengaluru-based health-tech startup focused on preventing diabetic foot complications through AI-integrated wearable solutions. The company has developed dynamically self-offloading insoles that mechanically redistribute pressure without relying on sensors or actuators. The Digital Podiatry Clinics (D-PoC) offer early screening and diagnosis, while AI-powered Foot Digital Twins provide personalized foot health monitoring and predictive care. StrideAide’s mission is to make advanced diabetic foot care accessible and effective for patients across India. The core technologies include biomechanical engineering, artificial intelligence, and LLM models for clinical decision.

TruePixel’s mission is “to open a new future through SPAD sensor technology.” By combining proprietary circuit design, photon-level detection algorithms, and scalable CMOS fabrication, the company aims to create industrial-grade, mass-producible sensors.

The British High Commission in India, located on Shantipath in Chanakyapuri, New Delhi, serves as the United Kingdom’s primary diplomatic mission in India. It plays a pivotal role in maintaining and strengthening bilateral relations between the UK and India, as well as Bhutan. Headed by the British High Commissioner, the mission represents the UK government and oversees political, economic, cultural, and defense cooperation. The High Commission provides essential consular services to British nationals living in or visiting India, including passport renewals, emergency travel documents, and assistance in cases of illness, crime, or bereavement. It also facilitates visa and immigration service

Profile:
ULOOK Technologies Pvt. Ltd. is a Bengaluru-based space intelligence company developing autonomous satellite swarms for RF sensing, geolocation, and spectrum awareness. The company is pioneering RF Fingerprinting from Space, a breakthrough that identifies and classifies emitters by their unique signal characteristics. Its proprietary payload suite, PulseTrack, delivers real-time RF intelligence and geolocation across satellites, drones, and high-altitude platforms, supporting applications in maritime domain awareness, dark ship detection, disaster response, and environmental monitoring.

Its flagship products include Wegro Nurch, a modular green railing system that incorporates aeroponics into balcony railings, and the Wegro Pod, a smart indoor gardening appliance that makes it simple for users to grow fresh, pesticide-free greens. When combined, they turn unused urban areas into aesthetically pleasing and useful green spaces. Wegro wants to change the way urbanites interact with nature by fusing sustainability, design, and technology, making home farming an appealing and feasible aspect of contemporary life.
